home.firstArticle: Making websites is not as hard as it might look. Any programming language is much much easier than any of human languages. And if you learned your language you can learn any programming language. This website looks quite hideous but it's only because I am very bad at design. Everybody can learn how to do it. Believe me. Just 8 weeks ago I didn't know the difference between div and span. And today you can see what I've done. It ain't much but it's a honest work.

person.name: Mikhail Krivoshchekov, but call me Mike please

disclaimers.one: According to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (EU) 2016/679. Information contained on this website may be privileged or confidential and intended for the exclusive use of the original recipient. If you have visited this website by mistake, please leave the website immediately and delete it from your history.
disclaimers.two: Any information contained on this website are confidential and are intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. If you have visited this website by mistake, you must not copy, distribute or disclose of the information it contains.
disclaimers.mobile: And this website is mobile friendly, give it a minute and visit it with your phone or tablet. Thanks.

experience.relevantExperienceContent: Currently my only relevant experience is developing this website
experience.irrelevantExperienceContent: I used to work from a seller of electronic components to a welder on construction yard. From vehicle repairman to a hospitality manager in hostel. But all of these is irrelevant.

gradientLine: this line represent the mastery of a skill from red (low) to green (high)
